subject: Re: [junit] Re: Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
msgSnippet: ... Ok so imagine that your test fails and that a NullPointerException is thrown _somewhere_ in your code. Here s the output of your test: There was 1 failure
messageBody:
> testFileNotFound(){
> try{
> FooFileLoader f = new FooFileLoader( "unknownfile.txt" );
> fail( "FileNotFoundException expected, got none" );
> } catch( FileNotFoundException e ){
> // success!
> } catch( Exception e ){
> fail( "FileNotFoundException expected, caught: " + e );
> }
> }

Ok so imagine that your test fails and that a NullPointerException is
thrown _somewhere_ in your code.

Here's the output of your test:

There was 1 failure
1) testFileNotFound(MyTestClass)
java.lang.NullPointerException
at MyTestClass(MyTestClass.java:line_number)
at ...

Now I ask you: what is the next step you will do to know _where_ the NPE
has been thrown (since you don't have any stacktrace that could show you
the location of the failure)?

-Vladimir
